description:
Only one of seven bills aimed at preventing AI’s penchant to discriminate when making consequential decisions — including who gets hired, money for a home or medical care — has passed.

The post Attempts to Regulate AI’s Hidden Hand in Americans’ Lives Flounder in US Statehouses appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Attempts to Regulate AI’s Hidden Hand in Americans’ Lives Flounder in US Statehouses

description:
Backdoored JAVS courtroom recording and management software installer puts thousands at risk of complete takeover.

The post JAVS Courtroom Audio-Visual Software Installer Serves Backdoor appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: JAVS Courtroom Audio-Visual Software Installer Serves Backdoor

description:
Averson secures seed funding to build technology that uses AI to identify cloud security weaknesses and counter cyberattacks.

The post Averlon Emerges From Stealth Mode With $8 Million in Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Averlon Emerges From Stealth Mode With $8 Million in Funding

description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Chinese repair ships might be spying on undersea communications, spyware found at hotel check-ins, UK not ready for China threat.

The post In Other News: China’s Undersea Spying, Hotel Spyware, Iran’s Disruptive Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: In Other News: China’s Undersea Spying, Hotel Spyware, Iran’s Disruptive Attacks

description:
Exploited in the wild, Chrome vulnerability CVE-2024-5274 is a high-severity flaw described as a type confusion in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine.

The post Google Patches Fourth Chrome Zero-Day in Two Weeks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Google Patches Fourth Chrome Zero-Day in Two Weeks
